revised_title: Investigating the Remains of a Mediterranean Volcano and its Associated Gas
tldr: The author examines the remains of a recently extinct volcano in the Mediterranean and collects samples of gas rising from its site. The gas is found to be composed of about 10% oxygen and 90% nitrogen, with no signs of flammability or smell of sulfur. The author speculates that the gas may have originated from the sea water interacting with the hot volcanic materials, rather than directly from the volcano itself.
